posts.author: DMScreener
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Best lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about Best that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with Best and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Best?

posts.author: RulesMaster
posts.content:
My DM interprets spells differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for spells are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

I think the 2024 changes to spells make it much more balanced compared to before.

posts.author: FighterFanatic
posts.content:
For my next character, I want to focus on spells as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

In our last session, we encountered a Gelatinous Cube and tried to use spells to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

The way I understand the rules for spells, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

In my campaign, we had a situation with spells that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
